name: SORAT Hotel Ambassador Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideal if you are on a weekend to Berlin and just need somewhere to put your head down at night. Although basic, the rooms are large and clean. The hotel staff are efficient and friendly, always happy to help you with directions etc. The breakfast in the hotel is excellent, offering a wide selection of hot and cold food. We particularly liked the waffle machine for making our own waffles! In the hotel reception there are a various leaflets for all the sights of Berlin, and the zoo is only a 5 minute walk away. It's about a 10 minute walk to zoo station where you can get a train to all the main sights in the east and only takes about 10 minutes. Around the hotel itself there are plenty of bars and restaurants and the department store Ka DeWe is just around the corner, as well as many many other shops, and they were setting up the Christmas market as we were leaving.
reviews.title: Ideal for a city break!

reviews.text: Stayed here in Standard double at the end of August with our four year old. A couple of minutes from the Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn, & 5-10 minutes walk from Zoo' U-Bahn, with many restaurants, takeaways, cashpoint, late-night supermarket & market nearby.
reviews.title: Central,clean,comfortable with superb breakfast

likes.liked: — central but quiet location, clean, comfortable & superb breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found all reception staff very helpful and friendly. Room clean & comfortable with shower & bath, & curious double room door which provided good noise insulation. Bar was pricy, but with generous snack portions. Were able to check in over three hours early & leave luggage after checking out. Buffet breakfast was exceptional; vast choice of cereals (& seeds!), hot sausage, chicken, eggs & bacon, make your own waffles (& we did!), fruit salads, yoghurts, rolls, jams (in , pastries, cold meats, smoked salmon & cheeses, juices, teas & even Sekt in an ice bucket!
reviews.title: Great hotel but beware, no A/C!

likes.liked: — Location to public transportation and Kurferstendamm

reviews.text: Only quibble was that the (large) breakfast room was very busy between 8-9am (breakfast served 06.30-11.00hrs), and we had a few minutes delay finding a table & had to ask for a jug of coffee, but this is nitpicking, overall a comfortable place to recover from & set you up for more sightseeing.
reviews.title: Nice, nice, nice

likes.disliked: — Okay, bed could have been better

reviews.text: Great hotel in excellent location near Kurferstendamm, KaDeWe, U-bahn, Zoo, and main train station. Only reason I haven't rated this hotel "Excellent" is because they don't have AC. If you're visiting during a cooler month, would highly recommend due it's central location, friendly staff, clean rooms and one of the best breakfast buffets we had in Germany. If you're visiting during a hot summer month, can't recommend this one. Staff was friendly and apologetic and offered us another fan - there was already one in the room - and gave us ice cubes. Couldn't sleep with window open due to the cigarette smoke that would fill up the room. Beer in the bar was 5 Euro, a bit high. Not the way we wanted to spend our last night in Germany - hot and sticky, but otherwise a great hotel. I'm amazed that in all the reviews I read on this hotel that no one mentioned no A/C. But at 95F days and 90F nights, A/C is just a must for us.
reviews.title: mixed bag

likes.disliked: — The lack of facilities in the room

reviews.text: We’ve recently returned from a weekend break in Berlin where we stayed at the Ambassador Hotel. This hotel doesn’t pull any punches but merely “does what it says on the tin.” We arrived late Thursday evening and were ushered to our “standard double room” only to find that it was actually a twin room. This coupled with the fact that the room was boiling hot and lacked air conditioning hardly made for a good first impression. After a rather sweaty night’s sleep I approached the concierge to enquire about changing rooms. They were only to happy to show me another room, which for an extra 15 euros per night gave me a double bed, a larger bathroom, bathrobes, a much needed fan and access to the complimentary drinks fridge in the hall. I duly accepted and it proved to be well worth the dosh.
reviews.title: A warming experience

reviews.text: Breakfast was a hot/cold buffet open from 7-11am and was perfectly acceptable although a little tedious by the third day. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and spoke superb English. Location wise the Ambassador hotel isn’t great. It’s situated near to the Zoologischer Garten station (similar to London’s King’s Cross) and isn’t really near the Mitte (the hub of Berlin life). This of course meant taking public transport which as you’d expect, is extremely punctual and efficient.
reviews.title: Go there for breakfast

reviews.text: Overall, we’d have to stay that this hotel serves a purpose but be warned there is no air conditioning and I would advise against staying here during the summer months.
reviews.title: Nice clean room but not very nice staff

likes.disliked: — Front Desk Staff were too business like and not welcoming

reviews.text: We often stay in hotels in Berlin, most of the time 5 star hotels. On our way to Poland we stayed in Kempinski (terrible, see review). On our way back we stayed in this 3 star hotel and didn't expect that much. But we were surprised, the hotel is simple but nicely done (you don't need to spend much money to make something nice). The rooms are big for a 3 star hotel (certainly compared to a 5 star hotel like Kempinski) and are in a good condition. The only disadvantage is that when it is really hot , it can be very hot in the room because we didn't have airco (I don't know about other rooms). Breakfast was the biggest surprise. This can beat breakfasts in many 5 star hotels! Lots of choice, make your own pancakes, champaign, etc. We liked the variety of the people (compared to some other hotels) and in combination with the low price, the excellent breakfast and the central location, I would say 'check it out'.
reviews.title: Low budget, clean Berlin hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was typical business class
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - incredible value for money. Book there NOW!!!

likes.liked: — I forgot to put in the review... I had FREE wifi internet access from my room. Very useful and F R E E :-)
likes.disliked: — Standard rooms lack AC, -not a problem really, but can be if its unusually hot for Berlin standards

reviews.text: This is a great hotel to stay in. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite and always helpful. The breakfast buffet served almost everything you could want.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Some rooms were not as spacious as others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located, taking only 2 minutes to walk to the KaDeWe (and the Kurfustendamn) and 5 minutes to the zoo.
reviews.title: Brilliant Value - great hotel

likes.disliked: — For the price - it was all good.

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately book it again when returning to Berlin.
reviews.title: Great Location Shabby Room

likes.liked: — The helpful staff and the location
likes.disliked: — Shabby room and lack of pillows and towels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked here via Ryanair website - for absolute bargain price (i.e. £35 a night). Hotel is in good location right by U station and minutes away from main shops including KaDeWe (a must visit is the food halls).
reviews.title: Happy Camper

likes.disliked: — really nothing bad to say about it bearing in mind it is a 3 star hotel.

reviews.text: Hotel is contemporary (not very trendy though) and clean. Room was a good size, clean and with large bathroom. Proper double bed - not two singles pushed together. Everything in the room was good - only small niggles were the height of the shower (bit low for my 6ft 4" husband) and the TV reception was not great for CNN. No minibar but soft drinks available from machine in corridor.
reviews.title: ambassador hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: Hotel was conveniently located steps from a subway station and key bus routes. Desk staff was friendly and very helpful at booking tours and providing directions. Only downside was lack of air conditioning in rooms, but in May, it was fine and could open windows to let cool air in when it got warm. Breakfast had a lot of variety and was very good! Would definitely stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked tripadvisor before booking this. But ... where did these people stay? Certainly not in the room that we're in right now! Furniture with chipped off paint everywhere. A bis sticky spill of (I hope) Coke on the desk. There's a small door here with a tiny sticker saying: "This door is locked, no minibar." hmmm. And I have not been able to locate the fridge with the free drinks. There's a coke vending machine by the lifet. Coke for 2 EUR. Certainly no free drinks. I still have the knob of the wardrobe door lying here next to ma computer. The toilet flush need lots of jiggling to stop flushing. The window opens fine but I had quite a task trying to get it back into its frame to close it again.
reviews.title: Rooms fit for a youth hostel

reviews.text: Certainly not a hotel I would recommend. We're moving out tomorrow morning to find another hotel.
reviews.title: Great choice for older travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed 4 nights in early April at the Ambassador. I had a good quality room for the price: 20% discount for a 4-night stay, about 72.00/night USD for a single, including a huge and varied buffet in an attractive breakfast room each AM. A plus at breakfast--large carafes of hot coffee at each table.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of English speaking TV channels (but this was only a minor thing)

reviews.text: Just off the Ku-damm and the former middle of West Berlin, this hotel was perfect for the older traveler not looking for the nightlife of the Mitte, etc. It was close to U-Bahn, and an easy walk to Zoo train station and connections to the rest of Berlin and beyond.
reviews.title: Loved the Sorat Ambassador

description: You're looking for a city hotel in Berlin: Central, where the Ku'damm begins. Located at the famous KaDeWe.You have found your host! The SORAT Hotel Ambassador is midst the city west! An unconventional city hotel awaits you, with esprit and an own wellness studio. Ideal for your Berlin journey!
